newsitem.title: UK: BASF SAYS DOESN'T RULE OUT RESTRUCTURING.
newsitem.headline: BASF SAYS DOESN'T RULE OUT RESTRUCTURING.

text.p: German chemicals giant BASF AG said on Thursday it would reconsider its opposition to restructuring the group if a major strategic opportunity arose.
Chairman Juergen Strube said the company had no plans to float or divest its pharmaceuticals or oil or gas operations.
"We consider these businesses to be part of BASF permanently, but all businessmen understand that we should never say 'never'," he told a news conference here.
"If a specific situation arises where something of the highest strategic importance could be reached by divesting or floating part on the stock exchange, we would reconsider," he added.
